intro: Westringia quaterna, commonly known as the Four-leafed Westringia, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the family Verbenaceae and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of small, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and sandy soils, preferring full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are narrow and glossy, while the flowers range in color from white to pale pink, blooming in spring. Westringia quaterna is often cultivated as an ornamental plant for its aesthetic appeal and hardiness.
